_meta.description: Culture perspective - Tests: timeline, text, list, bar, citation, image

cultural_significance: One of the most prized wild mushrooms in European cuisine, with deep cultural roots in Italian, French, and Central European gastronomy

historical_timeline.event: Mentioned by Pliny as 'suilli' - pig mushrooms
Reserved for nobility in many regions
Becomes symbol of Italian autumn cuisine

culinary_heritage: Central to risotto ai funghi porcini, essential in French haute cuisine, and a symbol of Germanic forest culture
folklore: In Germanic folklore, circles of these mushrooms were believed to mark fairy dancing grounds. Italian tradition holds that the best porcini grow where lightning has struck.

literary_reference.author: Giacomo Castelvetro
literary_reference.title: The Fruits, Herbs and Vegetables of Italy
literary_reference.quote: The most noble of all mushrooms

protected_designation: Fungo di Borgotaro IGP - Protected Geographical Indication since 1993
